text: Q. 42 A splay tree is a binary search tree with the additional property that recently accessed elements are quick to access again. Time taken to access recently accessed elements again should be O(1). Based on the above information, insert 13 into the following splay tree and find the resultant tree. -—— 13is inserted, o e since it was accessed recently Solution : (©) After observing the question, it may feel like you should know how to perform insertion in a splay tree and do zig-zag rotations, but it is not required. (b), (d) options are not binary search trees anymore. So (c) option is correct. In option (a), 13 is mostly recently accessed and take O(height) time for access. So it is wrong.
